CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 16, 1965, pg. 9, reads: "Salutes Disc Jockeys - With The Three Sounds supplying the music, the Pittsburgh area disc jockeys were honored with a dinner at Crawford Grill No. 2 last week. Joe Robinson, owner, says, 'We must not forget these are the people who entertain us every day through radio and television.'  in picture are Joe Robinson, Bill Dowdy, drummer; Kathy Milton, WMCK; Harold Brown, Marlene Moore, Charles Bailey, Bill Powell, Phil Brooks, Gene Harris, pianist; Andy Simpkins, bass; Garner Lytel (Chicago), manager of the Grill; Kenny Reith and Cecil Holmes.  Other disc jockeys were invited.  Others present but not in the picture include Hillary Bodden, WJAS; Al Germany and Allen King, WZUM. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of band "The Three Sounds" with Andy Simpkins, Gene Harris, and Bill Dowdy holding their albums, surrounded by disc jockeys Cathy Milton, Harold Brown, Marlene Moore, Charles Bailey, Phil Brooks, Garner Lytel, Kenny Reith, Cecil Holmes, Bill Powell on left in rear, and Joe Robinson on right, posed in Crawford Grill No. 2
